page.title: 04FARMING - AUCHINLECK
page.content: The lands surrounding Auchinleck are gently rolling green fields separated by rows of trees, hedges or fences.They are ideally suited for grazing or arable purposes. Most of the farms are dairy farms with breeds of Ayrshire and Hereford but there are also herds of beef cattle such as Charolais and Simmental.The crops are mainly grass,hay and silage for feeding, with a few root (potatoes,turnips) and grain crops. Milk is collected from the farms by tankers and taken to the local dairy. Animals can be bought or sold at the weekly market at the nearby town of Ayr.
